info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 22 at 6:29PM CDT until July 22 at 7:15PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT FOR EAST CENTRAL RAWLINS AND WEST CENTRAL DECATUR COUNTIES... At 629 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 10 miles southeast of Ludell, or 11 miles southeast of Atwood, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. Brief landspout tornadoes may be possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Rawlins and west central Decatur Counties. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
